item.title: Uncover the Alias Pattern
item.description: While I write OOP code I apply some practices of Elegant Objects. One of them is that classes should be final. This means that they cannot be extended through inheritance but only through composition. The advantage is simplicity. I mean that, in this way, each object is seen as a cohesive block. What interest to its clients is its exposed behaviour. Nothing more. Instead, through extension, a client can break it.
